newsitem.title: GERMANY: German homosexuals hold annual march in Berlin.
newsitem.headline: German homosexuals hold annual march in Berlin.

text.p: Thousands of gay and lesbian Germans held their annual Christopher Street Day procession in the heart of Berlin on Saturday, calling for an end to discrimination on the grounds of sexuality.

The parade, one of many around the world held to recall street battles between police and homosexuals in New York's Christopher Street in 1969, wound through a city-centre route which included the Unter Den Linden avenue.
Many of the participants carried placards calling for German law to recognise homosexual marriages.
Police said around 10,000 people had taken part in the procession while organisers put the figure at 60,000. Around 250,000 of Berlin's 3.5 million population are homosexual, the organisers said.
